657dae42-c4e7-4c0b-ba65-ea78a0384cff.description: NAU’s Sustainable Ambassador Program mission is to prepare students to take on the world’s sustainability challenges as individuals, community-members, and professionals. It aims to accomplish this by educating every Lumberjack about the basics of climate science and the tenets of sustainability and inspiring graduates to live in a manner that contributes to solving our global environmental challenges.
657dae42-c4e7-4c0b-ba65-ea78a0384cff.name: Sustainable Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Complete "Sustainable Ambassador" pretests. These pretests gauge your base knowledge of climate change and sustainability before going through the program!

2. Attend two courses on Sustainability and Climate Change.  These crash course take you from the basics to more complex climate science and sustainability topics. These will show how we incorporate justice issues, finances, and the planet in one conversation.
3. Perform two hours of volunteer work. It can be anything from shoveling a neighbors driveway to joining the Green Jacks for a trash clean-up. This activity is all about giving back!
4. Attend one sustainability event. This event could either be on Campus or in the City. Search "GreenNAU" as a keyword on the NAU online calendar to find an upcoming sustainability event.
5. Attend the sustainability workshop. These workshop help you communicate what you have learned. There is at least one workshop per semester, don't miss it!

e6d0bb65-72e3-4150-ba21-1242c8782464.description: The AZ Classroom Readiness & Teacher Training Preparation program provides training for international teachers transitioning to a U.S. classroom. Led by faculty from NAU's College of Education, graduates developed a thorough understanding of the American education system, teaching techniques, and cross-cultural classroom communication strategies. Graduates completed 45 hours of online instruction and 15 hours of instruction in classroom communication.
e6d0bb65-72e3-4150-ba21-1242c8782464.name: Arizona Classroom Readiness and Teacher Training Preparation Program 2021

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Introduction to issues in the U.S. Education System a. Research and analyze a range of educational issues b. Summarize the issues related to the current trends in education covered in class. c. Reflect on the role of diversity in K-12 education

2. Classroom Management and Instructional Planning a. Plan to establish classroom procedures and expectation (rules) to promote a positive, effective and efficient learning environment. b. Construct a classroom schedule/time management plan that includes a variety of common constraints, topics, and modes of instruction c. Analyze case studies for legal, ethical and professional issues and concerns, and propose professional solutions

3. Introduction to Special Education in the United States a. Apply UDL principles to create an inclusive and culturally responsive learning environment. b. Identify the physical, emotional, linguistic, social, and cognitive traits of students with disabilities and how they could affect individual student learning c. Describe the benefits of Response of Intervention (RTI) to meet the needs of students with exceptionalities
4. Current Trends in Teaching Modes/Methods/Technology a. Design an effective distance learning plan. b. Analyze curriculum that engages students

490a087c-48a2-4807-b2ac-9b138a585c59.description: This course gives international teachers a grounding in issues surrounding the social role and social practice of schooling, with emphasis on teaching and learning in classrooms and on school organization. We explore the philosophy and psychology of teaching children in Arizona, including students with exceptional learning needs, and an overview of the U.S. educational system. We believe that all students, with and without disabilities, deserve quality and differentiated instruction.
490a087c-48a2-4807-b2ac-9b138a585c59.name: Arizona Classroom Readiness and Teacher Training Preparation Program 2022

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Exercise the ability to analyze and articulate the context, content, and meaning of particular educational issues.
2. Explain the impact of population shifts and the importance of cultural proficiency in relationship to public education systems.

3. Synthesize contemporary issues in education including developing methods for appropriately integrating technology within the parameters of differentiated instruction and culturally responsive teaching.

4. Plan to create safe, inclusive, culturally responsive learning environments so that individuals with exceptionalities become active and effective learners and develop emotional well-being, positive social interactions, and self determination (CEC 2.0)
5. Use knowledge of general and specialized curricula to individualize learning for individuals with exceptionalities (CEC 3.0)

6. Consider an individual’s abilities, interests, learning environments, and cultural and linguistic factors in the selection, development, and adaptation of learning experiences for individuals with exceptionalities (CEC 5.1)

7. Standard #3: Learning Environments-The teacher works with others to create environments that support individual and collaborative learning, and that encourage positive social interaction, active engagement in learning, and self-motivation.

8. Standard #10: Leadership and Collaboration-The teacher seeks appropriate leadership roles and opportunities to take responsibility for student learning, to collaborate with learners, families, colleagues, other school professionals, and community members to ensure learner growth, and to advance the profession.

The student will gain an understanding of the role and responsibilities of a financial planner, along with some analytical skills to aid in financial decision-making.
dce63548-f0d2-478d-a1b5-c736c93f8d49.name: Fundamentals of Financial Planning

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Explain the CFP Board’s Code of Ethics and Professional Responsibility and apply the Rules of Conduct. Explain the CFP Board’s Disciplinary Rules and Procedures and distinguish between the CFP Board’s disciplinary actions
2. Describe the CFP Board’s Financial Planning Standards and integrate them in the development and communication of a client’s financial plan.
3. Define and compare the function, purpose, and regulation of financial institutions.
4. Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of investment advisor regulation and the regulatory authorities that impact elements of the financial planning process.
5. Describe consumer protection laws that impact clients.
6. Discuss the fiduciary standard and understand its importance to the planner-client relationship.
7. Describe the financial planning process and recognize unethical practices in the financial planning profession.
8. Evaluate how a client’s attitudes, values, and biases will affect his/her goals and a planner’s recommendations. Apply the principles of behavioral finance, communication, and counseling.
9. Identify sources of money conflict and communicate the importance of congruent family financial goals.
10. Identify and evaluate crisis events with severe consequences. Communicate potential solutions to help clients navigate crisis implications.
11. Analyze debt financing strategies and create client debt management plans.
12. Perform education needs analysis and develop an education financing plan. Compare and recommend education savings vehicles and financial aid options.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have completed the Mentor/Mentee program packet, meet with mentee 4 or more times and established clear goals and expectations. They have completed at least 2 workshops focusing on communication skills and one session of workshops on Diversity through NAU Office of Inclusion. They have acted as a positive role model, helped clarify & set expectations of the mentor/mentee relationship & provided relevant guidance and constructive feedback to mentee.

cb5a8d98-32de-46b7-917f-8f476ba9be9e.description: Shirtsleeve Startup is an introductory course for entrepreneurs who may not have formal business experience, but are interested in the steps involved in creating a business of their own. The course covers legal questions, incorporation, development of a business plan, identifying sources of financing, planning a budget, marketing the product, identifying competitors, and much more.
cb5a8d98-32de-46b7-917f-8f476ba9be9e.name: Shirtsleeve Startup: Module 1

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of Shirtsleeve Startup: Module 1

2ef4c123-da43-4b90-9201-15c04e45e69d.description: Earners of this Career Readiness Badge know how to demonstrate personal accountability and effective work habits, integrity and ethical behavior, the ability to learn from mistakes, and knowledge of how non-verbal communication may impact professional image or reputation. Complete the Career Step online lessons below and achieve at least 80% on each lesson quiz to earn this badge.
2ef4c123-da43-4b90-9201-15c04e45e69d.name: Career Readiness: Professionalism & Work Ethic

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the "Establishing Your Professional Identity" Career Step online lesson and quiz, which covers describing how to present oneself as a professional and recognizing that norms and behaviors vary based on the environment.
Complete the "Dressing for Professional Contexts" Career Step online lesson and quiz, which covers identifying and applying context-appropriate professional dress.

Complete the "Communicating in the Workplace" Career Step online lesson and quiz, which covers identifying and applying context-appropriate professional communication strategies in verbal, non-verbal, and written formats.

Complete the "Building Your Personal Brand" Career Step online lesson and quiz, which covers identifying opportunities to build a personal brand through the power of perception and by effectively one's communicating strengths, interests, values, and transferable skills.

Complete the "Building and Maintaining Workplace Relationships" Career Step online lesson and quiz, which covers recognizing different roles within a professional support network one might play and identifying strategies to contribute to an organization through building healthy and effective work relationships.

84b7d059-8a0f-4534-b359-94780d216183.description: The program is intended for faculty wishing to improve their courses by leveraging collaboration strategies, alternative assessments and technology to maximize engagement in their courses. The intermediate badge is organized around three competencies and takes approx. 45-60 hours to complete. Earners will employ alternative assessments to promote student engagement, design collaborative strategies within synchronous and asynchronous platforms, and utilize technology to engage learners.
84b7d059-8a0f-4534-b359-94780d216183.name: Current Trends In Engagement Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Achieve at least 80% of the assessment criteria in Fundamentals in Leveraging Google Workspace for Education & Microsoft 365.
Achieve at least 80% of the assessment criteria in MS Teams for Student Engagement, Collaboration for Learning in Online Environments.
Achieve at least 80% of the assessment criteria in An Experiential Workshop and Alternative Assessments to Promote Engagement.
Leverage technology to engage learners.
Create effective collaboration activities.
Devise alternative assessments to promote learning.

be70d099-1f40-4bc6-9e32-a37a1d1f0b44.description: Earners of this badge will develop knowledge about a tax-efficient diversified portfolio considering risk preferences, investment strategies, and alternative investments with focus on corporate financial analysis and selection of long-term projects for firm value maximization.
be70d099-1f40-4bc6-9e32-a37a1d1f0b44.name: Investment Concepts

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Explain the uses and taxation of investment vehicles. 2. Describe investment risk and returns. 3. Interpret quantitative investment concepts. 4. Value debt securities (bonds) and equity securities (stocks). Explain approaches to stock valuation. 5. Construct a diversified portfolio. 6. Develop investment strategies. 7. Develop asset allocation and portfolio rebalancing strategies. 8. Recognize characteristics of economic cycles. 9. Understand alternative investments and liquidity risks.

3e5e8388-8ca7-442e-845f-d622c525db4d.description: Attend three one-hour sessions on Microsoft Teams that cover navigation, sending posts and chats, collaborating on files, and organizing tasks. Participants earn the Intermediate badge by attending all three of the following sessions: Intro to Teams, Microsoft Planner, and Teams Meetings & Files.
3e5e8388-8ca7-442e-845f-d622c525db4d.name: Microsoft Teams at NAU Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a one-hour Intro to Teams session, presented by a Microsoft Innovative Educator certified instructor. By participating in the virtual training and watching a demonstration of a real Teams environment and use cases, participants are presented with realistic scenarios and ideas for how to use Teams in their areas.

Attend a one-hour session on Microsoft Planner, presented by a certified  Microsoft Innovative Educator. Participants view real-life examples of Planner and how they can be adapted for a variety of use cases. Alternate layouts, filtering options, and dashboards are explored. Participants are encouraged to share and brainstorm potential solutions.

Attend a one-hour session on Teams Meetings & Files, presented by a certified Microsoft Innovative Educator. Participants learn best practices and options for scheduling, hosting, and attending Teams Meetings. Participants also focus on file-sharing and co-authoring features, while learning about the relationships between OneDrive for Business, Teams, and SharePoint.

74fd5177-3b7d-4d48-8593-633ed988f424.description: Earners of this badge will develop knowledge about risk identification, risk evaluation, and risk treatment methods for businesses and personal clients. Students will learn how to perform an insurance needs analysis, so that they are able to evaluate and recommend appropriate techniques for their clients.
74fd5177-3b7d-4d48-8593-633ed988f424.name: Risk Management and Insurance

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Explain the principles of risk management. 2. Analyze and evaluate risk exposures. 3. Contrast short-term and long-term liability plans. 4. Calculate the tax implications of disability benefits. 5. Compare annuities to other investment types. 6. Distinguish between qualified and non-qualified annuities. 7. Explain underwriting factors. 8. Distinguish between the three types of buy/sell agreements. 9. Perform an insurance needs analysis. 10. Define and communicate key insurance policy terms.

444f4f66-f679-499a-b0f2-71bd88e70094.description: Earners of this badge attended the virtual Employee Development Days in 2021.
444f4f66-f679-499a-b0f2-71bd88e70094.name: Virtual Employee Development Days Participant 2021
